result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek M. Pederson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Falsely Present Noncontrolled Substance, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(4)(am)1a.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with prison sentences Defendant is presently serving.  0 days credit.  All costs have been remitted by the Court.  DNA sample to be provided if none already has.

Defendant to submit to booking on this matter.  DA Harper to follow up with the institution regarding this matter.
Concurrent with: all sentences being served

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derek M. Pederson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Derek M. Pederson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek M. Pederson appeared by telephone means from Jackson Correctional (video was attempted but visual connection did not hold).  14CF100 and 14CF102 called together.

DA states that, in 14CF100, there will be a waiver of prelim; State carries over same charge as complaint; def to plead GNC for jt recommendation of 1 year jail, concurrent to def's presence sentence; 14CF102 to be dismissed.  Atty. McDougal concurs with that recitation.

Court - State vs. Soto allows def to proceed to plea/sentencing video; Court conducts colloquy with Def as def is wishing to proceed to plea/sentencing via telephone.  Def waives his right to be present.

Atty. M - Def waives formal reading of the information, presented to the Court this date by Atty. M, along with the plea waiver form.

Court's colloquy with def re waiver of prelim.  Def waives right to prelim.  Court orders def boundover.

Court's colloquy with def re plea questionnaire/waiver.  Atty. M states she went over the waiver with the def over the phone in May.  Def has not signed the plea questionnaire/waiver.  Further colloquy.

Def pleads no contest.  Court's colloquy on plea.  

DA notes def needs to be booked on these charges in the institution; if institution cannot book him, institution should contact the RCSD.  DA states she will follow up on that matter.

Court follows jt recommendation and sentences def to 1 year jail, concurrent with all sentences def currently serving.  Def to pay costs of the action and must submit DNA sample.  Surcharge imposed.  No credit.  Atty. M asks the Court to remit the costs due to def's prison incarceration in other matters.  Court remits the costs.

14CF102 is dismissed.

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Derek M. Pederson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek M. Pederson not in court; in correctional facility.  14CF100 and 14CF102 on the calendar today for adjourned initial appearances but attorneys stated that the parties are ready to proceed to plea/sentencing.  Court has attempted to connect to facility via video; connection didn't hold.  Matters are reset for July 1st at 9 - adjourned initials that will likely end up as plea/sentencing.  Def wants to appear by video.  DA's office to make the arrangements.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derek M. Pederson via telephone from Jackson Correctional with attorney Lisa A McDougal in person.  Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty M requests matter be setover again. Def may appear via video.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Derek M. Pederson appeared by video means with Attorney Lisa A McDougal in person. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty M. requests completion of initial appearance and reset for status. Court notes prelims have not been completed. Def can appear via video.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

14CF100 and 14CF102/adjourned initial.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Derek M. Pederson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derek M. Pederson appeared by video means from Jackson Correctional.  Atty. M states def waives right to formal reading of the complaints and also waives the time limits in which to hold prelim; asks for status, noting that def has matters in another county.  Atty. M asks that status be set no further than March.  Court sets these as adjourned initials (to serve as reminder that the prelims haven't been held) for Friday, 3/13.  Atty. M states def would prefer to appear by video again rather than be transported.  Def concurs.  So next appearance will again be by video.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Derek M. Pederson via video from Jackson Correctional with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA requests matters be setover to a future date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Back on the record 1/6/15 @ 3:39 p.m. DA requested matter be heard as defendant has refused to sign his signature bond. DA requests def be released from signature bond in both matters. Court releases defendant from signature bond.

2 cases called together (14CF100, 14CF102). Defendant Derek M. Pederson in court, in custody without counsel.  Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def has received copies of the complaints, waives formal reading. Court informs def of the charges/maximum possible penalties as well as right to counsel. Court instructs def to contact SPD and will set these matters over. $5000 signature bond in each case. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
